result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Foxx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 46 days were granted if imposed.
Concurrent with: Case 20CM1521
Court will allow transfer to the County where the defendant resides.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, Conditions, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No Contact with the victim, to include their residence, listed in the criminal complaint. Make best efforts to maintain/obtain full time employment. Cases 20CM651 and 21CM1697 were dismissed and read in.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Foxx

defendant.name: Foxx, Brandon L
defendant.address: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Herbers.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:55 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Brandon L Foxx in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Brandon L Foxx.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the pretrial offer as listed in the document.  Defense and the State confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Counts 1, 3 & 4 be dismissed and read in.  Court also orders that cases 20CM651 & 21CM1697 be dismissed and read into this case. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Herbers.


COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

2 Years & 6 Months Imprisonment (Concurrent to Counts 2 & 3 in 20CM1521 - 46 Days Credit IF revoked and imposed)
-      1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program IF revoked.

Term of Probation: 2 Years - Court will allow transfer to County where defendant resides.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with the Victim, to include their residence, listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription;
-	Make best efforts to Maintain/Obtain full time employment.

COSTS:  $243.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Court to apply the $400.00 cash bail on deposit in 21CM1697; remainder to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon L Foxx
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 2000 S 68Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53219

9:51 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brandon L Foxx in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Brandon L Foxx.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Herbers provides an update; he is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing as soon as possible.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:42 PM Defendant Brandon L Foxx in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia for attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Brandon L Foxx. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
